author: trent_vanepps
content: What’s the latest browser benchmark and what do we expect it to be in production? (If there is anything that we expect to change between now and then)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> would be super keen on that number @kevaundray

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  I was getting around 10-15 seconds in chrome from the benchmark website I linked, it was updating a SRS of size 2^16 using multiple threads. 

Mileage may vary with Safari due to the bug I mentioned before.

I'd need to double check the specs for expected changes and get back to you (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <Trent Van Epps> What’s the latest browser benchmark and what do we expect it to be in production? (If there is anything that we expect to change between now and then))

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Link to previous message regarding benchmarks: 

https://t.me/c/1580662017/219

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> I didn't do anything special regarding optimsations except for use wnaf, so its most likely possible to get better numbers

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> This is much better than I expected. I didn't know you could do multi-threading in WASM?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Could you benchmark with 2 cores, which hopefully most participants have?

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Yeah you can emulate multi-threading using web workers in the browsers (re @dankrad: This is much better than I expected. I didn't know you could do multi-threading in WASM?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  For 1 core, I think Geoff integrated the Rust code and got roughly 1 minute (single thread)

For two cores, we don't have benchmarks, but I can get them if Geoff doesn't integrate it soon (re @dankrad: can we get 2 and 1 core?)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> very nice. So performance-wise we are already roughly on target then

author: bridge-bot
content: <trent_vanepps> echoing dankrad, this is really exciting!
